subject: Art & Design
title: Film Festivals: Cannes, Venice, and Sundance
description: A quick, practical guide to Film Festivals: Cannes, Venice, and Sundance.

hook.text: The Palme d'Or at Cannes is cinema's most prestigious award. Winning it can define a director's entire career.

buildup.text: Film festivals premiere new work, connect filmmakers with distributors, and set critical consensus.

discovery.text: Cannes (est. 1946) champions art cinema. Sundance (est. 1978) launches independent films. Venice is the oldest (1932).

twist.text: Many blockbusters skip festivals entirely. Festivals and box office success often reward completely different films.

climax.text: Sex, Lies, and Videotape (Sundance), Pulp Fiction (Cannes), and Brokeback Mountain (Venice) all launched at festivals.

punchline.text: Festivals don't predict box office. They predict cinema history.
